document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Labidostomis (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cryptocephalinae: Clytrini) with large united elytral spot from Iran and adjacent countries

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Labidostomis (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cryptocephalinae: Clytrini) with large united elytral spot from Iran and adjacent countries

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Labidostomis limbata :
Rapilly 1984a : 135
(valid species);
Regalin & Medvedev 2010 : 571
(catalogue).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type localities.
Clythra limbata
: “ Palestine ”;
Labidostomis laetus
: “ Israel , Golan Hills”;
Labidostomis heinzi
: “ Israel , Golan, El Rom”.

Types examined.
Clythra limbata
: Holotype: ♀, “[illegible, w, h] // 23058 [w, p] // limbata Lac. * [w, h] // Zool. Mus. / Berlin [w, p] // Type [r, p] // HOLOTYPE [r, p] // Labidostomis / limbata Lacordaire [h] / M. Rapilly dét. 19 [p] 83 [w, h]” (ZMHB).

Labidostomis heinzi
: Paratypes: 2 ♂♂, “ISRAEL [p] / Kuneitra / 6.4. [h] 19 [p] 68 [h] / leg. Bytinski—Salz [w, p] // Labidostomis / heinzi Lop. [h] / det. I. Lopatin, 19 [p] 90 [w, h] // Paratypus [p] / Labidostomis / heinzi Lopatin 1990 [r, h]” (TAU); 2 ♂♂ 6 ♀♀, “Israel / 1987 Heinz leg. [w, h] // Golan ca 1000m / El Rom 1987 / Heinz leg 14.IV. [w, p] // Paratypus [r, p] // Labidostomis / heinzi sp. n. [h] / det. I. Lopatin, 19 [p] 88 [w, h]” (USNM).

materialsCitation.collectorName: El Quinatirah & El Rom & K. Steven & Bab El Hawa & Ma & Bental & L. Friedman

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnostic characters. Body length: ♂♂ 6.0–7.0 mm; ♀♀ 5.6–8.0 mm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 13–18. Male mandibles and clypeal processes. 13—
Labidostomis elegans
; 14—

Scale bar: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. Israel ( Lacordaire 1848 , Medvedev 1992 , Lopatin 1993 ,
Lopatin et al 2003
, present paper), Syria (
Lopatin et al 2003
).

Differential diagnosis. In
L. limbata
, head and pronotum are dull and labrum is black while head and pronotum are more or less lustrous and labrum is at least partly yellow or brownish in other species (except part of the specimens of
L. regalini
sp. nov.
with black labrum). The males can be easily distinguished by the colouration of elytra with anterior margin of large elytral spot straight and reaching apex of scutellum, anterolaterally regularly emarginate around humeral spot ( Fig. 32 ). The females has humeral spot connected with large discal spot ( Fig. 33 ) what is unique within studied group.

Comments. The name
Clythra limbata Lacordaire, 1848
is junior primary homonym of
Clytra limbata Steven, 1806
(now
Smaragdina limbata
), however may be preserved because the senior homonym was placed in other genus before 1900. The case requires an application to the Commission. Until the decision of the Commision the name
Clythra limbata Lacordaire, 1848
can be used ( ICZN , Art. 23.9.5).
